Some Lesser Known Facts About Shraddha Pandit

Shraddha was born to a family of musicians and actors.

She grew up in Mumbai.

She started working at the age of 11.

When she was very young, she sang a song titled Saaz, which was composed by the late Indian musician Ustad Zakir Husain.

When Shraddha and Shweta were young singers, they often visited the studios where Lata Mangeshkar recorded her songs along with their father.

The song Saaz catapulted her to the limelight following which she was contacted by Salim, who trained her in music composing and programming.

Even though she sang her first Bollywood song in 1998, she got her breakthrough as a singer with the song Pehli Pehli Baar Baliye from the film Sangharsh (1999).

Her first song was composed by her father.

Shraddha Pandit is a follower of Sai and Lord Shiva.

She considers herself to be a very spiritual person and often visits Vrindavan in Mathura, Uttar Pradesh.

Shraddha wants to visit the 12 Jyotirlingas of Shiva in her lifetime.

She learned Hindustani Classical Music from her deceased grandfather Pandit Pratap Narayan (Sangeet Acharya). She was motivated to pursue a career in singing after watching him sing.

Pandit Jasraj is her granduncle, father Vishwaraj Pandit is a tabla player, music composer Jatin-Lalit is her uncles and music composer Late Aadesh Srivastava was married to her aunt Vijayeta Pandit.

She has worked with many popular Indian musicians such as A. R. Rahman, Amit Trivedi, Salim–Sulaiman, Sonu Nigam, and Badshah. She has appeared in around a hundred concerts with Salim and Sulaiman.

In September 2013, Shraddha revealed that many music composers refused to give her work since she came from a family of well-known singers.

Her fame increased when she sang Rang Deeni from the 2004 Bollywood film Dev. She sang alongside Kailash Kher in the song.

In 2008, she sang along with A. R. Rahman and Sukhwinder Singh in the song Mann Chandre Nu. For this, Rahman took a voice test of Pandit before allowing her to sing.

Her 2015 song Pani Wala Dance was liked a lot by her fans and followers.

In 2018, after her sister Shweta made allegations of Anu Mallick sexually abusing her, Shraddha took to social media claiming that all working in the Hindi film industry know that he is a “predator.”

In 2019, she worked with her sister, Shweta Pandit, for the first in composing a song that was dedicated to bringing peace to Jammu and Kashmir.

Some of her well-known songs include Aye Shivani from the film Khoobsurat (1999), Sasural Genda Phool from the film Delhi-6 (2009), Band Baaja Baaraat (2010) Jigar Da Tukda from the film Ladies vs Ricky Bahl (2011), and Aiyo Ji from the film Satyagraha (2013).

She has also sung a song for Salim-Sulaiman, which the duo had composed for a Hollywood film.

As a lyricist, she has written the lyrics of Date Kar Le (2020), Nawazishein (2022), and Biraj Mein Jhoom (2022).

She spends a considerable amount of time on Facebook and Instagram.

In 2021, she filed an FIR against her former manager, Dev Thakur, accusing him of threatening her. The incident happened when Dev and Shraddha entered into an argument. Dev, however, refuted the allegation against him as false and baseless.

On 10 May 2022, Shraddha Pandit was appointed as the director of the Women’s Integrated And Synergistic Empowerment Association.

She once claimed despite making repeated requests, many renowned song promoters did not agree to promote her song I Got That Poison” (Hisss Remix). This was her debut as a composer.

She is an avid dog lover and owns a pet Shih Tzu named Muffin.

Shraddha Pandit was seen in the reality TV show Gusto With GD in 2023. She appeared in one episode.

In April 2024, she appeared as a judge in the reality TV show Super Singer+ Rajasthan. The show aired on the First India Plus OTT platform.

She is a travel enthusiast and has visited various places to explore them.

Shraddha Pandit indulges in smoking occasionally.

She often goes to the gym and likes to perform callisthenics.
